title: What Inflation Will Do to Your 2022 Taxes
sub_head: The IRS tax tables are getting a bigger-than-usual adjustment this year, thanks to the rising cost of living
body:
Inflation is back, at least for now, and that matters for your taxes.
In November, inflation rose 6.8% from a year earlier, nearly a four-decade high as measured by the Labor Departmentâ€™s consumer price index. For new cars (up 11%) and fast-food restaurants (up 7.9%), the jump in prices was the largest on record.
